item.title: Data Analytics Architect
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Analytics Architect

Job Description

RBC is a digitally-enabled relationship bank. We strive to engage our customers when, how and where it’s most convenient and to provide a highly-personalized experience. We also collaborate broadly with innovative business and technology partners to create a platform and ecosystem that can bring even more value to our customers. We care deeply about the success of our customers and communities.

We’re looking for an experienced solution architect who is passionate about our mission to join the RBC Digital team. We want vocal futurists that can advocate their vision, who will be excited about creative problem-solving as part of a cross-functional team with customer focus and will strive for the best end-user experience in addition to having the drive and desire to keep learning the latest architecture developments, standards and techniques.

The primary focus of this position is to provide technology and architectural leadership with respect to the design and delivery of highly-scalable customer data and insights solutions leveraging machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) platforms.

This work will support development and delivery of information-intensive initiatives based on common practices for multiple complex projects.


What will you do?

  • Collaborate with business leaders to determine how to best apply technology to enable growth and success (e.g. scalable domain-driven solutions, operational reporting, SRE practices)
  • Provide architectural strategic thinking, information solutions, and input into roadmaps to drive delivery
  • Ensure architectural compliance of solutions and introduce recommendations for changes to reference model(s) when needed.
  • Maintain a plan to address gaps between current and target state architectures
  • Participate in \'reuse, buy and build\' decisions.
  • Understand potential impacts of proposed solutions on other systems, processes and/or projects
  • Articulate and document designs, considering trade-offs, costs, and benefits
  • Develop ongoing knowledge of current and emerging technologies
  • Identify new and emerging solutions, assess relevance and potential value to the organization, and present findings to teammates and management.
  • Participate in day-to-day execution of the architecture strategy
  • Develop blueprints and conduct design reviews to ensure architectural compliance of solutions.
  • Work across multiple projects and systems to develop, communicate, and mentor others on solution design, implementation and operation patterns and best practices

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Background in data architecture, analytics, and cloud native solutions
  • Experience with analysis techniques and measurement tools to continuously build valuable insights and business recommendations.
  • Strategic mindset with strong change management, continuous improvement and transformation skills
  • Strong technical skills in application development (data pipelines, services, streaming platforms)
  • Knowledge of identity and data access management and security best practices
  • Working knowledge in data acquisition, data storage & computational patterns with industry standard tools
  • Experience supporting mission-critical applications in production
  • Software engineering skills with distributed computing background and proven experience in delivering large-scale data platforms.
  • Good understanding of data fabric/mesh concepts and semantic layers

Nice to have:

  • Business or product leadership experience
  • Hands-on working experience with cloud native solution such as SnowFlake, DataBricks, Azure Data Factory, AWS Glue/Lamba, RedShift, Azure DW.
  • Experience with next generation solution delivery on technologies such as Python, Kafka, Spark, Apigee, Jenkins; container solutions including Docker/Kubernetes; and private cloud platforms such as Openshift (OCP) or Pivotal (PCF)
  • Exposure to building and deploying predictive and prescriptive analytics models using any of the following: Python SciKit, R and Pytorch.
  • Experience with Salesforce (CRM), Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC) and/or Palintir Foundry

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Member of the front-end chapter, which provides training, events, and other opportunities for learning. You will also have an opportunity to share your work and experience with your peers

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • A world-class training program in financial services

  • Flexible work/life balance options​

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

Canada

item.title: Analyst, Client Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Analyst, Client Data Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

You will be part of the Controls & Governance team of the Client & Data Management Group (C&DMG), provide monitoring and performance analysis for the all aspects of C&DMG covering Capital Markets.

Reporting to the VP, you will be accountable for supporting and implementing programs and governance structures to optimize and improve efficiency through more effective use of data insights and relationships across business groups across Capital Markets.

You will work with stakeholders to implement the methodology, metrics and program standards for the assigned portfolio to ensure compliance to SLAs as well as effective monitoring, timely reporting and identification of action plans around KPIs and KRIs.

What will you do?

  • Support the delivery of business analytics
  • Ensure data is consistently maintained to agreed operational and regulatory standards throughout the client lifecycle.
  • Help maintain & monitor an inventory of data & key controls showing ownership,
    frequency and SLA’s across the client lifecycle.
  • Support the development of actionable ongoing management reporting that is focused on trends and includes proactive identification and reporting of emerging risks (KPIs and KRIs).
  • Monitor the metrics from the risk and control framework and ensure that the ongoing health of the processes are monitored
  • Ensures sustainable remedial action when issues are identified.
  • Proactively identifies operational risks/control deficiencies in the business and opportunities to improve the team & client experience.
  • Collaborate to create processes and monitoring tools, following a risk based approach including appropriate exception management and escalation policies.
  • Supports ongoing reporting that is focused on trends and emerging risks
    from different sources of information across business units.
  • Support the creation of a consolidated view of risk and performance, including initiatives, compliance deficiencies and corrective action.

What you need to succeed?

  • Undergraduate degree
  • 4+ years of Capital Markets experience
  • Quantitative analytic skills, including experience with data analysis and data presentation
  • Strong database experience and GUI development experience
  • Expertise in one or more of Python, VBA, and Tableau
  • MS Office, with particular expertise in Excel and PowerPoint
  • Superior verbal & written communication skills
  • Superior analytical & problem solving skills
  • Demonstrated ability to manage ambiguity in a difficult/stressful work environment
  • Demonstrated knowledge & experience with risk and quality control frameworks
  • Collaboration & team skills; with a focus on cross-group collaboration

Nice-to-haves

  • Formal qualifications as Graduate or Post-Graduate Level.
  • Knowledge of products and operations of Capital Markets, Investment Banking
  • Creative thought process and ability to innovate
  • Attention to detail while working with high volume of data and transactions

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Flexible work/life balance options

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same.  Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

RBC exige, à titre de condition d’emploi, que tous les candidats retenus aux États-Unis ou au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 avant leur date d’entrée en fonction. Il est possible qu’ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d’adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l’exige

The analyst works with stakeholders to produce metrics for effective monitoring, timely reporting and identification of action plans around KPIs and KRIs.

item.title: Manager, Fraud Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Fraud Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

You will effectively gather data, analyze it and translate the results into non-technical business information on which informed decisions will be made.  You will perform exhaustive root cause analysis to uncover actionable insights, conceive and validate ideas and partner with stakeholders to help optimize performance against Fraud’s four pillars: fraud loss, client experience, operational cost and risk framework.  You will synthesize complex analysis into highly relevant, easy to understand, non-technical packages with clear, actionable recommendations and apply analytic proficiency in conjunction with Fraud subject matter expertise to proactively identify the most valuable questions to answer and problems to solve.  

Please Note: Applicants from outside of Toronto and Montreal are welcome to apply and work remotely.

What will you do?

  • Define analytical objectives, source relevant data, perform in-depth analysis and present clear, concise and actionable insights to stakeholders in a timely, accurate and effective manner
  • Deliver exhaustive root cause analysis by proactively identifying the most valuable questions to answer and problems to solve, and communicate reasonable assumptions and inferences based on business knowledge
  • Support the business with ad-hoc insights and data points and deliver results to a wide variety of technical and non-technical stakeholders, to help them make well-informed decisions based on empirical evidence
  • Explore and works with a variety of data sources, extracting knowledge and actionable information from massive datasets, and present findings and recommendations in a well-structured and easy to understand manner
  • Perform extensive data validation/quality assurance analysis on large datasets, identify and resolve information that needs cleansing and updating, troubleshoot, investigate and fix data anomalies and issues 
  • Work independently and with team members to understand database structure and business processes, evaluate workflow inefficiencies and action areas of improvement
  • Serves as data expert and continuously strives for a deeper understanding of fraud business drivers.
  • Manage stakeholder expectations, negotiate priorities between stakeholder interests, collaborate with team to ensure the highest value deliverables are completed and foster a culture of collaboration and engagement

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 2+ years of experience working with big data, including data analysis, database technologies, analytical software packages and BI/visualization tools (e.g. Python, Spark, SQL, SAS, Dataiku, DataRobot, Tableau)
  • Knowledge of Fraud products and Fraud-related applications
  • A love for insights, innate curiosity and a deep desire to find ways to create value
  • Passionate problem solver, with proven ability to break down problems, formulate the right questions and develop analytical insights
  • A good business sense and understanding of why data is pulled and if it seems accurate, not just pulling it
  • Comfortable working in a complex data environment and understanding of data structures
  • Efficient time management and organizational skills, and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
  • Exceptional communication skills and behaviours
  • Bachelor degree in a quantitative discipline or equivalent professional experience

Nice to have:

  • Advanced University Degree in a quantitative discipline

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • Competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities    

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Director, Partnership Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, Partnership Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role, you will lead analytics / pre-sale discussions with strategic partners and is seen as the “Go-To” person for multiple opportunities / partners.  You will leverage rich client data to influence Enterprise Partnership strategy.  You will constantly enhance analytical framework to demonstrate the value of partnering with RBC.  You will own the overall team roadmap and building new capabilities in a reusable way

What will you do?

  • Directly influences Enterprise Partnership team and delivers results directly (via internal teams) or indirectly (via external partners)
  • Member of Enterprise Partnership leadership team
  • Member of Loyalty Analytics leadership team
  • Develops the vision, strategy and roadmap for partnerships from an analytical lens
  • Co-develop aspects of external partner facing materials to articulate the power of partnering with RBC
  • Contributes to thought leadership in Enterprise Partnerships
  • Coach and mentors direct reports and builds their skills, knowledge and abilities
  • Provides thought leadership across Loyalty Analytics team
  • Lead a team of 4-6
  • Trusted to autonomously lead a team to partner with Enterprise Partnership team, and escalates appropriately.
  • Ability to work through and reduce ambiguity for others
  • Demonstrates maturity in business judgment

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • 10-12+ years of functional experience
  • Results focused with the ability to meet tight timelines
  • Strong communication
  • Lead in a fast pace and matrix organization
  • Hands on SQL experience, and able to coach junior team members.
  • Build /coach team members up on data visualization tools (e.g. tableau)
  • Ability to work with large and complex data sets
  • Build scalable data foundations to enable analysis, dashboards, models, etc.
  • Build and present presentation materials that are clear, succinct and relevant to the audience
  • High level of accuracy/attention to detail, especially with partner facing material

Nice to have:

  • Senior level stakeholder management & Influence
  • Experience in Client or Loyalty Analytics
  • Operates well within white space
  • Python & R experience

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

item.title: Manager, CRM Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, CRM Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC is hiring an exciting Manager, CRM Analytics role. In this role, you will work closely with members of the CRM Analytics team and collaborate with various partners including the Lines of Business across Personal and Commercial Banking providing actionable insights and developing solutions that enhance the client experience and drive value for the business.

What will you do?

  • Examine and evaluate all facets of the marketing leads conversion process in order to produce key findings and recommendations that augment offer fulfillments
  • Analyze utilization of Outbound resources to optimize marketing opportunities for individual campaigns
  • Analyze Call Centre and Branch Inbound client interaction sessions to enhance actioning and fulfilling of product and service offers
  • Conduct marketing contact channel analyses to provide pertinent information and proposals supporting Client Interaction Strategy to enhance client experience and drive business values
  • Develop dashboards and monitor performance of various marketing channels to ensure client interactions are uniquely managed in the constantly evolving environment
  • Deliver insightful and actionable analytics to underpin the Client Growth initiative enabling client acquisition and retention across all lines of business
  • End-to-end responsibility for campaign analyses including framing of analytical objectives with partners, sourcing relevant data, performing in-depth analyses and presenting key insights to stakeholders in timely and effective manner
  • Provide analytical support in other associated client and marketing initiatives

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • Proficient technical knowledge with very large relational databases and with tools such as SAS and SQL
  • Sound business acumen and strong analytical, communication and presentation skills
  • Strong problem solving skill and ability to conceptualize strategy
  • Demonstrated ability to work well collaboratively in a cross function environment as well as independently with initiative taking ownership

Nice-to-have:

  • Master’s degree in quantitative discipline
  • Experience in financial services industry with broad understanding of marketing, product management, sales, finance, pricing and risk management
  • Experience with Hadoop and Google Analytics

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

item.title: Manager – Financial Data Analytics, Insurance Finance Special Projects
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager – Financial Data Analytics, Insurance Finance Special Projects

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Financial Technology, Analytics & Data Modeling:  Responsible for the development of the SQL, Dataiku, Python or other programming code that drives Financial Models, Analytics and Prototypes through the IFRS 17 accounting implementation for RBC Insurance.  Configure, develop and update the prototype to consume specific product data.  Understands various documentation stakeholder requirements, and proposes, defines, and implements the overall system documentation structure design.   Integration and analytics on Accounting Sub-Ledger and related technologies.
  • Activity Based Costing:  responsible for the development of Access Database construction and maintenance supporting the Activity Based Costing and Allocation Processes including Financial Modeling.
  • Financial Control Testing:  Works closely with IT partners on development and testing of controls over Financial Data and Measurements over Accounting Sub-Ledger and Enterprise Data-Lakes.   Support users in resolving production issues and applying bug fixes. Contributes to development, execution, and/or documentation of testing processes and test cases related to project deliverables.
  • Audit and Documentation: Conducts financial testing on data, systems and processes to ensure compliance with documentation.  Works in concert with the Transformational Team in the design & implementation of a Future End-to-End Data, System and Financial Solution.  Create and maintain technical documentation for supported systems.  Prepares documentation and/or presentations relating to:  methodology; processes; implementation; testing; controls / governance; end user documentation / training, and analyses performed.
  • Operational Efficiency:  Identify and suggest opportunities to improve efficiency and functionality. Engage in activities for the ongoing improvement of the team’s knowledge and capabilities.
  • Program Implementation:  Contributes to successful completion of project objectives under tight timelines, including via identification of risks, agility, resolution of ambiguity, and development of mitigation strategies.

 What do you need to succeed?

  • Bachelor’s degree (or greater) majoring in Business,  Finance, Mathematics,  Engineering or Computer Science
  • 4+ years of financial / accounting data manipulation tools using Python or other similar programming skills    Experience in QlikView, Tableau, Dataiku reporting and/or R/ SAS programming skill
  • Experience working and/or implementation of Accounting sub-ledger
  • Ideal candidate having 5+ year’s exposure to the Insurance Financial Industry with insurance product, investments, and insurance policy accounting knowledge (Life, Health, P&C and Wealth) or equivalent experience.  Knowledge of IFRS, Canadian GAAP and/or Actuarial Standards of Practice
  • Motivated self-starter, able to pick up new concepts quickly
  • ‎Strong financial modeling skills, and ability to mine and manage data
  • Outstanding technology skills
  • Excellent ability to structure and write clear technical system, process, and methodology documents of varying lengths
  • Ability to communicate complex concepts concisely to technical and non-technical audiences, in written form
  • Strong conceptual, analytical, and problem solving skills
  • Ability to grasp technical details and determine macro-level issues
  • Teamwork, collaboration, and co-operation is a requirement
  • Engage in the full software development life cycle up to and including hand-off to users

    Job Summary

    As a key member of the Insurance IFRS 17 Project team you will be responsible, through your knowledge of Financial Data Analytics, for the end-to-end development of key IFRS 17 RBCI financial models used in compliance with life insurance industry regulatory requirements. This will include development, delivery, documentation and acclimation of models among key stakeholders in the business.
    You will work closely with fellow RBC team members from finance and actuarial building financial technical documentation, requirements, illustrations and testing of Insurance Contract measurement against accounting, financial and actuarial systems.

    **Please note this is an 18 month contract role

item.title: Manager – Financial Data Analytics, Insurance Finance Special Projects
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager – Financial Data Analytics, Insurance Finance Special Projects

Job Description

Manager – Financial Data Analytics, Insurance Finance Special Projects

What is the opportunity?

As a key member of the Insurance IFRS 17 Project team you will be responsible, through your knowledge of Financial Data Analytics, for the end-to-end development of key IFRS 17 RBCI financial models used in compliance with life insurance industry regulatory requirements.  This will include development, delivery, documentation and acclimation of models among key stakeholders in the business. 

You will work closely with fellow RBC team members from finance and actuarial building financial technical documentation, requirements, illustrations and testing of Insurance Contract measurement against accounting, financial and actuarial systems.   

What will you do?

  • Financial Technology, Analytics & Data Modeling:  Responsible for the development of the SQL, Dataiku, Python or other programming code that drives Financial Models, Analytics and Prototypes through the IFRS 17 accouting implementation for RBC Insurance.  Configure, develop and update the prototype to consume specific product data.  Understands various documentation stakeholder requirements, and proposes, defines, and implements the overall system documentation structure design.   Integration and analytics on Accounting Sub-Ledger and related technologies.
  • Activity Based Costing:  responsible for the development of Access Database construction and maintenance supporting the Activity Based Costing and Allocation Processes including Financial Modeling.
  • Financial Control Testing:  Works closely with IT partners on development and testing of controls over Financial Data and Measurements over Accounting Sub-Ledger and Enterprise Data-Lakes.   Support users in resolving production issues and applying bug fixes. Contributes to development, execution, and/or documentation of testing processes and test cases related to project deliverables.
  • Audit and Documentation: Conducts financial testing on data, systems and processes to ensure compliance with documentation.  Works in concert with the Transformational Team in the design & implementation of a Future End-to-End Data, System and Financial Solution.  Create and maintain technical documentation for supported systems.  Prepares documentation and/or presentations relating to:  methodology; processes; implementation; testing; controls / governance; end user documentation / training, and analyses performed.
  • Operational Efficiency:  Identify and suggest opportunities to improve efficiency and functionality. Engage in activities for the ongoing improvement of the team’s knowledge and capabilities.
  • Program Implementation:  Contributes to successful completion of project objectives under tight timelines, including via identification of risks, agility, resolution of ambiguity, and development of mitigation strategies.
  • Engage in the full software development life cycle up to and including hand-off to users

 What do you need to succeed?

  • 4+ years of financial / accounting data manipulation tools using Python or other similar programming skills Experience in QlikView, Tableau, Dataiku reporting and/or R/ SAS programming skill.
  • Bachelor’s degree (or greater) majoring in Business,  Finance, Mathematics,  Engineering or Computer Science.
  • Ideal candidate having 5+ year’s exposure to the Insurance Financial Industry with insurance product, investments, and insurance policy accounting knowledge (Life, Health, P&C and Wealth) or equivalent experience.  Knowledge of IFRS, Canadian GAAP and/or Actuarial Standards of Practice.
  • Motivated self-starter, able to pick up new concepts quickly
  • ‎Strong financial modeling skills, and ability to mine and manage data
  • Outstanding technology skills.
  • Excellent ability to structure and write clear technical system, process, and methodology documents of varying lengths.
  • Ability to communicate complex concepts concisely to technical and non-technical audiences, in written form.
  • Strong conceptual, analytical, and problem solving skills.
  • Ability to grasp technical details and determine macro-level issues
  • Teamwork, collaboration, and co-operation is a requirement.

Job Summary

As a key member of the Insurance IFRS 17 Project team you will be responsible, through your knowledge of Financial Data Analytics, for the end-to-end development of key IFRS 17 RBCI financial models used in compliance with life insurance industry regulatory requirements.  This will include development, delivery, documentation and acclimation of models among key stakeholders in the business. 

You will work closely with fellow RBC team members from finance and actuarial building financial technical documentation, requirements, illustrations and testing of Insurance Contract measurement against accounting, financial and actuarial systems.

item.description:

Job Title

Manager, Reporting & Analytics

  • The Manager, Reporting & Analytics will work within Operations to develop, design, implement and manage executive reporting that supports Data Centre Infrastructure & Strategy (DCIS) strategic priorities. In addition, the incumbent will also guide and shape strategic choices of the Senior Management team by building out the reporting and analytic ecosystem, delivering ad-hoc analytics and be a subject matter data expert.

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics, you will work closely with Digital Platform Product Owners, LOB Product Owners, Marketing and Sales teams, and Senior Management to structure analyses, uncover analytic insights, develop net new data assets, build dashboards and model data that will enable data-driven decisions.

In this role you will be responsible for supporting the end-to-end implementation of the analytics lifecycle - data collection, deep dive insight analytics, reporting and presentations.

You will provide objective, value-added insights and analysis to enable product owners to make strategic data-driven decisions. The person in this role will build critical understanding of RBCs products and the associated client behaviours to help deliver business value. The delivery of business value in this role comes from a combination of knowledge transfer to key stakeholders and the provisioning of data services and tests to client facing applications. 

What will you do?

  • Insights and Analytics:

    • Execute analytics plans on large data sets representing the behaviors, demographics and product attribute of prospects and clients. 

    • Use a variety of analytical methods (descriptive, diagnostic and predictive) such as causal inference, time series analysis, and hypothesis testing to find actionable insights

    • Develop and test hypotheses on data and data models

    • Based on evidence, make recommendations to leadership and stakeholders to support strategies and drive decisions

  • Data Collection/Ingestions/Acquisition:

    • Collaborate with data developers, DevOps, data engineers and cloud engineers to implement new data collection/ingestion/acquisition

    • Support business stakeholders in identifying needs for additional data acquisitions, and coordinate plans to orchestrate data acquisitions

    • Find, clean and structure data

    • Develop templates and systems for repeatable processes

  • Digital Product Reporting and Presentations:

    • Support the creation of Business Intelligence reporting that can be automated using reporting tools

    • Define, communicate and enforce reporting and analytics standards, policies and data governance

    • Help construct presentations in story format

    • Deliver clear, concise and timely reports and presentations identifying trends, issues and opportunities 

  • Stakeholder Consultancy:

    • Support relationships with key business stakeholders to develop, execute and monitor complex insights and analytical solutions to business problems using a variety of analytical approaches and methodologies.

    • Digest complex problems and organize into achievable milestones. Manages stakeholder expectations and keeps them up-to-date with project statuses.

    • Apply expertise and think creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine 

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have

  • 5+ years\' experience in related digital product development, marketing analyst or data mining role

  • Proven analytics and problem solving skills

  • Strong drive and desire to understand relationship of organizational components

  • BA/BSc or above in mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative field

  • Advanced experience with SQL, Python, or Scala

  • Knowledge of advanced digital analytics methodologies such as experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, surveys and market research.

  • Strong team player with track record of collaboration and experience working as part of an agile team

Nice-to-have

  • Experience with Spark, Scala, Hive, Python is a preferred

  • Good understanding of AWS Big Data services such as Amazon S3, EMR and Glue

  • Experienced with Jupyter Notebooks, IntelliJ, Visual Studio Code other notebook environments

  • Experience working in Unix/Linux environments

  • Experience working as part of an agile team using Github and JIRA

  • Experience with digital data collection tools such as Google Analytics

  • Knowledgeable in data modeling, data orchestration and data pipeline 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • A world-class training program in financial services

  • Flexible work/life balance options

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         

  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Il est possible qu\'ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d\'adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l\'exige

item.title: Associate Director, Market Risk Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Market Risk Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Group Risk Management (GRM) provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling, and reporting on the nature and extent of all material market risk on the RBC London Trading Floor – ensuring implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures.

We are looking for someone to manage the development and strategic rollout of the reporting infrastructure for Structured Rates and Global Equities businesses. The incumbent will have strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills – and a track-record of delivering infrastructure changes by devising solutions and liaising with key stakeholders towards project completion.

You will have previous coding experience in Python, VBA, and SQL. You will be able to write tactical scripts where needed, whilst working with key stakeholders to drive strategic change. Hands on experience with Tableau (or similar) is required and  should ideally have a basic understanding of financial products and the main risk factors within the interest rate and equity businesses.  

What will you do?

  • Develop indepth knowledge of the current and strategic reporting infrastructure state
  • Propose, build, and develop tactical and strategic enhancements to the reporting infrastructure
  • Repurpose and rebuild the existing VBA-based reports to the strategic model/infrastructure
  • Enhance Tableau-based reports, and optimise existing reports
  • Co-ordinate project plans, and work with key IT and Risk Management stakeholders to drive deliverables to completion
  • Automate various daily tasks involved in the current reporting infrastructure, including implementation of control frameworks and best-practise checks
  • Provide support to the Risk Managers on day to day running of risk reports
  • Regularly update and clearly communicate progress and milestones with GRM management/users

What do you need to succeed?

 Must-have

  • Strong leadership skills and vision ; proven record of leading a team/project and delivering value-added results
  • Hands on experience working on large datasets and databases
  • Ability to understand and clearly communicated around highly complicated reporting infrastructure dependencies related to books of complex derivatives portfolios
  • Proficient in VBA/Python/SQL
  • Hands-on experience of Tableau
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills ; is able to articulate ideas, thought processes, and recommendations confidently and rationally to senior audiences
  • Relevant experience working with Group Risk Management/Trading at a top-tier financial company
  • Good understanding of the day-to-day responsibilities of Market Risk, and daily risk reporting
  • Preferable knowledge of derivatives and greeks for interest rate and equity option products, Stress testing and scenario analysis and value-at-Risk measurement

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible working options fully supported.

Job Summary

Group Risk Management (GRM) provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling, and reporting on the nature and extent of all material market risk on the RBC London Trading Floor – ensuring implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures.

We are looking for someone to manage the development and strategic rollout of the reporting infrastructure for Structured Rates and Global Equities businessses. The incumbent will have strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills – and a track-record of delivering infrastructure changes by devising solutions and liaising with key stakeholders towards project completion.

The person will have previous coding experience in Python, VBA, and SQL. The person should be able to write tactical scripts where needed, whilst working with key stakeholders to drive strategic change. Hands on experience with Tableau (or similar) is required. The person should ideally have a basic understanding of financial products and the main risk factors within the interest rate and equity businesses.

item.description:

Job Title

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In alignment with RBC’s collective ambition to “Win as One RBC”, the role of the Manager, Performance Analytics and Reporting supports the Director – Regional Support & Executive Dashboards, and Distribution Analytics team in their ability to execute P&CB Regional Banking strategy and drive achievement of in-year objectives.

The Distribution Analytics team collaborates with product/channel groups, Regional Banking leaders and teams across Canadian Banking National Office to help drive business results by providing relevant and timely reporting and analysis supporting both Retail and Business areas. You will work directly with Regional Banking leadership to develop, design, implement and manage Executive reporting that support strategic priorities. In addition, you will also help guide and shape strategic choices across the Regional Banking reporting and analytic ecosystem, deliver ad-hoc analytics, and be a subject matter data expert.

What will you do?

Leverage financial acumen to synthesizes and distil key information to enable faster Senior Management decision making and assists in establishment of action plans to maximize business performance.

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

item.title: Director, Product Owner, Data & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director, Product Owner, Data & Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Opportunity to lead two growing and successful Data Service products: the Event Engine and PATH. 

The Enterprise Event Engine (Events and Transactions Service) enables action from data by offering a centralized view of all client, process and application events.  Events are standardized and streamed in real-time to support data-driven decision making, process automation and an improved customer experience.


PATH is a journey analytics platform that connects and analyzes process performance from millions of data points across systems and channels to uncover opportunities to improve client experience and operational efficiency

What will you do?

  • Clearly define and document “what” needs to be built including identifying the prioritized feature set and dependencies, with a focus on the 3-6 month time horizon.

  • Working directly with Sr. Product Managers, Business partners and DNA leadership to understand business strategies and use cases (requirements), ensuring product features and roadmap are aligned to business needs and delivering business value

  • Responsible for the creation and maintenance of the product roadmap (features) and implementation plans and successful execution against such plans.

  • Facilitate Agile processes (Stand-ups, Sprint planning, Sprint Retro, Backlog refinement, Sprint Review), and ensure Jira/ Confluence are up to date.

  • Lead the technical requirements gathering, consulting with internal stakeholders

  • Support the positioning of any new capabilities delivered, documentation and collateral for effective communication with partners and Executives

  • Support the Product Manager with the tracking and gathering of ongoing metrics related to adoption and usage

  • Support the development of architectural and design principles and standards to improve performance, capacity, resiliency and scalability of your product(s) to ensure safety and soundness

  • Ensure proper data governance and management is in place with data steward and data owners; creating the necessary PIAs and other privacy/governance/risk documents

  • Complete monthly Business Review Document (BRD). Perform product demo’s as needed and provide updates and supporting material for key meetings/ presentations. 

  • Complete monthly Business Review Document (BRD), and other key documents, in alignment and partnership with Product Management

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 5+ years proven track record of successful delivery leading products, programs or projects

  • Experience working with Agile software development 

  • Strong communication skills- written and verbal

  • Strong prioritization skills

  • Strong collaboration skills

  • Undergrad degree

Nice-to-have

  • Familiarity with platform, software, analytics, business intelligence technology

  • Financial Services  Industry experience

item.description:

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

SRE Director, Data Engineering & Analytics

Job Description

  • Leads in the technical design and development of cross-functional, multi-platform application systems. Applies advanced in-depth and/or broad knowledge, considered a top resource across the organization

item.title: Lead Developer Data Protection and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Lead Developer Data Protection and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The data protection team is at the forefront of delivering actionable insider threat and analytics services. Using data science practices tied to web and analytics services it helps highlight actionable events for ongoing investigations.

As the lead developer, you will be accountable for extending and enhancing current application services while working closely with product owners to develop and link together various components with a focus on overall fidelity of data models, optimization, product design and delivering enhancements as part of current managed web analytics services. This opportunity is suitable for someone who is skilled in web application development, motivated, someone who enjoy working on a variety of problems and enhancements, someone who works well in a multi-disciplinary team as well as working independently on key tasks.

If you want to innovate and be part of a big picture strategic delivery with a direct impact on organization change this is the placement for you!

What will you do?

  • Delivering new design and development specifications based on customer requirements, while adhering to standard procedures and techniques.
  • Creating test transactions and running tests to find errors and revise application programs.
  • Participating in post-implementation reviews of application development content and processes; continually working to create a learning environment by sharing about the participation process with others.
  • Supporting the implementation of application programs; fixing any existing or new bugs.
  • Design, Develop and enhance current web services
  • Help design, implementing and optimized UI functions
  • Collaborate within the team and stakeholders to enhance and expand current solutions

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • BS/MS in Computer Science or related area or equivalent experience
  • 3-5 years of professional full stack development
  • 3+ years with experience of working with Python/Java/HTML/CSS/SQL

  • Strong knowledge of web design, testing phases and working with data science
  • Understanding of software development lifecycle and experience with API
  • Experience of development in Cloud environment

  • Experience with relational databases(MSSQL, MySQL)

Nice to have

  • Experience with big data technologies – Hadoop, NoSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques, and graph technologies
  • Experience in building backend system with Python, Flask
  • Experience with CI/CD pipelines
  • Knowledge of DevOps and strong debugging skills

item.title: Senior Manager, Everyday Banking and Payments Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Everyday Banking and Payments Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Our Vision is to be Canadians’ leading choice for all payment and everyday banking activities, extending our market leading position through superior value, innovation, and differentiated experiences that drive acquisition and engagement.

In this role, you will be using data and analytics to improve our understanding of client behaviours, as well as improve in-market strategies and inform the design of our suite of products.

You will be working collaboratively with the broader Banking and Payments team, and use advanced analytical tools and multiple data sources (e.g. client segment data, bureau data, client behaviour data across all RBC products, online and mobile interaction data) in order to formulate strategies that optimize the business, enhance product construct, and provide value to our customers. Finally, you will be responsible for designing dashboards to support business reviews with Executives and complete deep dives to explain key trends and identify strategic opportunities.

What will you do?

  • Leverage complex data to provide analytics and strategic insights for business decisions and to explore new opportunities for Banking and Payments, including  

    • Detailed understanding of the product and segment analytics and financials

    • Business insight into acquisition and retention activities, channel performance and market share

    • Information in support of business optimization and business cases

    • Deep dives on new product innovation

    • Special projects as assigned

  • Work collaboratively with the Banking and Payments leadership team, and other analytics teams across the organization to enhance business decision-making through use of reporting, advanced analytics and combining multiple sources of data to measure key indicators of performance and early detection of opportunities, trends & anomalies.

  • Monitor and evaluate strategy effectiveness through the implementation of various tests (e.g. foundational testing, price optimization tests) and analysis on previous in-market tests and strategies.

  • Create materials to communicate the insights developed either through new monthly / quarterly reporting or specific stakeholder presentations and working sessions.

  • Work effectively with key stakeholders throughout the analytics and insights process to deliver high quality results aligned to the needs of the business.

  • Provide concise, timely and insightful reporting to senior management on relevant matters relating to Banking and Payments portfolio.

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and make data-based strategic decisions, while looking for opportunities to innovate.

  • Proficiency with data manipulation and analytical tools including Excel, SQL, SAS, Tableau, Python.

  • Proven ability to collaborate with a diverse set of stakeholders in defining and solving business problems.

  • Ability to be effective and equally conversant in business and technical environment.

  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., statistics, economics, business, engineering) to demonstrate ability for critical thinking & numerical analytics.

  • 5+ years related work experience in analytics, product or quantitative strategy roles.

Nice to have:

  • Experience in building financial models /valuations

  • Experience with statistical tools, test design, and predictive analytics

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Customer Insights, Data & Analytics Product Manager (Ownr)

Job Description

RBC Ventures is a new kind of business – one that marries the strength of one of the world’s most trusted and successful financial institutions with a mission to reimagine the role we play in people’s lives – to move RBC ‘beyond banking’. We’re building a world-class organization focused on designing exceptional experiences, exploring new business models and creating exponential value. In 2020, we were named by Fast Company as one of the 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators and we’re looking for team members with the curiosity to explore, the capabilities to build and capacity to help us deliver our mission

What is the opportunity?

Ownr is seeking a talented, experienced and passionate Product Manager focused on customer insights, Data & Analytics to join our growing team. In this role you will work across the business to support and manage the execution of data-related products and projects to help drive our customer understanding and cross-functional capabilities. We are looking for vocal futurists who have a passion for technology and are inspired by the idea of bringing to life product roadmaps that benefit hundreds of thousands of people at a key milestone in their lives.

About Ownr

At Ownr, we have helped thousands of Canadians establish their businesses. As we redefine the entrepreneurship landscape, we take pride in simplifying what it takes to be a business owner. We\'re on a mission to become the leading platform for entrepreneurship in Canada, and it takes an entire team to build something big. So join our team and discover how we can help entrepreneurs make their dreams a reality.

 

What you will do

  • Help set the product vision and strategy for data, analytics, and customer insights
  • Own the translation of business requirements, you will execute to deliver solutions that expand our data and analytics capabilities across multiple portfolios.
  • Design and conduct analyses using various techniques (developing frameworks, building dashboards, segmentation, modelling) to provide value for the stakeholders you support.
  • Responsible for creating and managing quality data products, processes and services to ensure growth and achievement of our business goals.
  • Understand our key drivers, customer use cases, and full user flow impact across all platforms.
  • Create, manage, and maintain KPI\'s to monitor, analyze and improve conversion
  • Lead the product planning and development process through backlog grooming, refinement, and prioritization activities
  • Define and detail User Stories and prioritize team backlogs in accordance to our business drivers.
  • Evaluate and document the requirements for each product feature, articulate these requirements, answer questions and make scope trade-off decisions as needed.
  • Ensure optimal delivery by removing barriers and obstacles that impact performance and develop contingency plans to demonstrate adaptability while supporting continuous learning.
  • Bridge technical, business and creative worlds, engaging with matrixed teams including development, UX/UI design, copy, legal, risk and compliance, creating a collaborative environment while maximizing on business return.
  • Drive internal stakeholders and cross-functional business unit engagements necessary for an optimal on-time launch.
  • Focus on backend functionality as well as user-facing features that make world-class user engaging platforms.

 

Skills you\'ll need to succeed

 Must have

  • Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in an analytical function (e.g. Business Analytics, Consulting).
  • Experience working as a Product Manager in a SaaS environment.
  • Proven work experience in data product management (growth-stage company experience a plus) and working with agile teams and organizations.
  • Experience translating business requirements to actionable software solutions.
  • In-depth knowledge of agile processes and principles, with the ability to provide direction to the agile team and stakeholders throughout.
  • Extensive experience developing use cases, epics and stories in a clear and concise manner, enabling the engineering team to deliver maximum productivity and value
  • Experience maintaining and prioritizing the backlog in accordance to business and technology drivers.
  • Experience in the planning of product releases and setting expectations for delivery of new functionality.
  • A Proven ability to make hard decisions in a fast-paced environment, while actively identifying and mitigating issues that have an impact on successful completion of goals.
  • Ability to speak to business functions, customers and partners with confidence and professionalism.
  • Commitment to winning as a team.
  • An entrepreneurial & innovative spirit

 

Nice to have

  • Experience with the development process, use of tools like GitHub
  • Experience using analytics tools such as: SQL, Amplitude, and Metabase

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options

 Launching and running a business can be daunting. But, at Ownr, we bring entrepreneurs closer to their dreams.

 

We have helped thousands of Canadians establish their businesses. As we redefine the entrepreneurship landscape, we take pride in simplifying what it takes to be a business owner. Our industry-leading tools, resources, and ongoing support make it as easy as possible for entrepreneurs to start and succeed.

RBC Ventures

item.title: Risk Analyst, Global Risk Analytics (Fall 2022 Student)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Risk Analyst, Global Risk Analytics (Fall 2022 Student)

Job Description

Please note: This posting is for a 4-month Fall 2022 Student placement with a start date of September 2022, and end date of December 2022. In order to be eligible for this 4-month Student position, you must either:

  • Be returning back to school after the work term end-date of December 2022; or

  • If you are not returning back to school (i.e. are graduating in December 2022), you must require the full 4-month work term as a mandatory component to in order to graduate successfully.

Please ensure that you meet these eligibility requirements before applying - candidates who apply but are found to be ineligible are not able to be considered.

What is the opportunity?

Global Risk Analytics (GRA) is the center of expertise for models used in risk measurement of market and counterparty credit risk for trading book. In particular, GRA is the owner of market data that is used to generate various scenarios for VaR/SVaR, potential future exposure (PFE) and stress testing in Capital Markets. Ensuring the quality of data is the foundation of good risk management.

Given the large size of market data (big data), advanced analytics such as machine learning needs to be leveraged.  Machine learning development with big data is highly iterative, including data labeling, model training, deployment and monitoring. If we can build tools and processes that enable high-throughput experimentation, we can make faster progress with various applications such as market data anomaly detection. In addition, alternative less structured data such as traditional and social media news often bring early warning signals for client credit quality monitoring. How to leverage news via machine learning is key to bring values for risk management.

GRA is seeking an individual who is interested in applying machine learning knowledge and programming skill to enhance our market data quality monitoring, as well as sentiment detection from alternative less structured data. The intern student will be working on market data anomaly detection and news sentiment detection and alert. The candidate will learn both machine learning and real business use case.

What will you do?

  • Learn about trading products and risk factors in capital markets

  • Research machine learning techniques with interaction of big data for data anomaly detection.

  • Implement new sentiment detection via natural language processing (NLP).

  • Make presentation to senior people in risk

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Strong programming experience in Python and SQL.

  • Knowledge about machine learning

  • Knowledge about quantitative analytics

  • Ability to communicate technical matters in written and oral forms

  • Team players to collaborate and innovate

Nice-to-have

  • Understand of the big picture regarding how risk function works in banks

  • Knowledge of financial products, especially fixed income and equity products

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work and make a difference

  • Opportunities to building close relationships

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.
 

We encourage you to apply as soon as possible as we accept applications on a rolling basis, but please note that the formal application deadline is 13th May 2022. Should you be selected to progress, someone from our team will reach out directly to provide instructions on next steps. Otherwise, feel free to check for progress updates by logging in to your RBC profile. If the status has not changed, it denotes the fact that your application is still under review.

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. The successful candidate for this role will be required to be located within Ontario for the duration of the work term. Details regarding the specific virtual, hybrid, and in-office arrangements for this Integrated Learning/ Co-op position are to be discussed with the Hiring Manager.

About RBC
Royal Bank of Canada is Canada’s largest bank, and one of the largest banks in the world, based on market capitalization. We are one of North America’s leading diversified financial services companies, and provide personal and commercial banking, wealth management, insurance, investor services and capital markets products and services on a global basis. We have over 80,000 full- and part-time employees who serve more than 16 million personal, business, public sector and institutional clients through offices in Canada, the U.S. and 37 other countries. For more information, please visit rbc.com.

Job Summary

Apply machine learning knowledge and programming skill to enhance market data quality monitoring, as well as sentiment detection from alternative less structured data.

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Strategy and Business Intelligence
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Strategy and Business Intelligence

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In this role, you will be part of Loyalty Portfolio Management and Analytics team, a COE supporting data and insights needs of Loyalty and Rewards Group (Strategic Partnership, Enterprise Partnership, Rewards Loyalty and Offers teams).  You will identify and lead technical solutions to optimize current processes, through synergizing data sources, developing self-serve tools, and partnering with cross-functional data SMEs. 

What will you do?

  • Act as subject matter expertise about Offers data (RBC Offers and Ampli Offers), and RBC card transaction data in RBC internal warehouse or source tables, leading data solutions in support of transformational initiatives of Loyalty and Rewards, to adding new linked loyalty partner data, and identify data solutions that provide efficiency and holistic view of offers value from clients and merchants perspective
  • Identify, plan and deploy opportunities to achieve higher operational efficiency, through improving data qualities ingested from different sources, automated existing manual processes, and developing templates and systems for repeatable processes
  • Support business stakeholders in identifying needs for additional data acquisitions, and coordinate plans to orchestrate data acquisitions
  • Partner and collaborate with other internal data partners (CIDM, Decision Management, CIDM) in providing automated reporting through different Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau and Thoughtspot

  • Communication skills (oral and written) with the ability to communicate clearly and concisely to all levels of the company and have a talent for making the numbers, measure and targets come alive
  • 5-7 years of related work experience

Nice to have:

  • Previous work experience within Cards or Banking business, Merchant Partnership or Loyalty experience an asset
  • Advanced analytics (R, real-time analytics , Advanced Visualization)
  • Experience with Enterprise Data Lake, Hardoop, ETL process
  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., statistics, economics, business) to demonstrate ability for critical thinking & numerical analytics

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. item.description:

Job Title

Sr. Data Analyst

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As the Senior Data Analyst, you will be part of Global Procurement\'s (GP) Data Management & Business Intelligence (DM & BI) team, supporting data and insight needs.  You will help manage delivering data from source to Global Procurement teams to help make data driven decisions; creating and updating reports to support the ever growing need within GP and assist the senior team members within DM & BI with various data mining related projects. You will be establishing and fostering strong, collaborative relationships with GP teams and continuously look for new opportunities to automate processes. You will be considered the COE of procurement data and the applications used to help drive data insight.  

What will you do?

Reporting & Data Analytics

  • Knowledge of Procurement and Organizational data to provides business with expert knowledge of data available to improve usefulness of reporting

  • Interact with Global Procurement teams to understand their operational reporting, dashboard and analytics needs

Business Analysis & Documentation

  • Meet with business partners to understand business requirements

  • Coordinates detailed business requirements phases identifying, tracking and resolving business systems issues

  • Develop plans and accurate estimates for completion of requirements, continuously improving the level of detail and accuracy of estimates

  • Manage risks, assumptions and constraints for requirements, and communicate to appropriate parties

  • Thoroughly document business requirements and translate to technical requirements

Communication  & Collaboration

  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with internal and external team members and business partners

  • Be a team player by proactively sharing best practices with other team members

Self-Development & Coaching (if applicable)

  • Proactively plan self-development activities and follow through

  • Look for opportunities to broaden own experiences/skill set and develop capabilities and knowledge

What will you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics, or related field; or equivalent experience

  • 1-2 years of experience in a data related role

  • Analytical programming languages (SAS, Python or R)

  • Experience in developing reports (e.g. Excel, Tableau, Power BI)

  • Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills

  • Attention to detail, organization and time management is critical.

  • Experience in a data analytical role.

  • Ability to effectively communicate data through effective visual storytelling.

  • Experience in presenting to senior management.

Nice to have:

  • Knowledge of Procurement processes
