item.title: Client Intelligence Associate
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Client Intelligence Associate

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Capital Markets Client Intelligence team is responsible for producing client, sales and business analytics to enable the businesses we support to effectively monitor performance and make informed business decisions. Our team works closely with the Sales & Trading and Corporate & Investment Banking divisions to design and produce KPIs that track business performance and the success of our firm’s key strategic initiatives. In addition to delivering best-in-class analytics, the team partners closely with technology to enhance our client analytics tools. Recognized as data stewards for the firm, the Client Intelligence team is tasked with identifying strategic data initiatives and leads cross-functional efforts to address data integrity and completeness issues.

What will you do?

  • Provide data, reporting and analytics support to business stakeholders and senior leadership

  • Integrate various data sources (internal metrics, client wallet data, qualitative feedback) to create insightful business analytics produce actionable client insights

  • Leverage competitive benchmarking information to identify opportunities to deepen client relationships, better focus sales efforts and drive revenue uplift

  • Partner with stakeholders to support the buildout of a holistic and consistent view of client profitability across RBC

  • Participate in the client planning process for Capital Markets and track actual to plan performance for senior management

  • Consistently look for ways to automate existing manual processes, driving change management to improve processes, accuracy of data & reporting, and efficiencies

  • Support data validation and participate in UAT for technology enhancements to our analytics platforms

  • Look for ways to improve our client technology platforms; partner with stakeholders and technology to increase the effectiveness of our analytics platforms

 

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher; at least 2 years of work experience in data, analytics and/or reporting

  • Positive attitude and collaborative approach

  • Strong written & verbal communication skills; ability to communicate confidently

  • Ability to multi-task and manage multiple initiatives and competing priorities at once

  • Influencing skills; ability to build relationships with key internal stakeholders and partners

  • Self-starter, ability to progress and deliver initiatives with little direction / oversight

  • Ambitious & driven; doesn’t settle for status quo and consistently looks for ways to improve

  • Demonstrated ability to organize large amounts of data and effectively present metrics and analysis

  • Proficiency in data & reporting tools (i.e., Qlik, Sisense, Tableau, SQL, Python or other)

  • Advanced proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, formulas, charts & graphs)

Nice to have:

  • Capital Markets experience, knowledge of Global Markets products (Fixed Income, FX, Commodities, Futures and Equities) or Corporate & Investment Banking businesses

  • Experience working in a trading floor environment with the ability to manage expectations in a fast paced environment

  • Experience and ability to effectively communicate to senior management in a concise manner

  • Strong presentation skills, ability to effectively convey messaging

  • Ability to synthesize large amounts of information to key takeaways and themes for senior management

  • Strong influencing skills and the ability to effectuate change

  • Experience in supporting senior leadership teams

  • Proficiency in Confluence, SharePoint, PowerPoint

 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work and take on greater responsibilities

  • Access to leaders who support your development through coaching and mentoring opportunities

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

item.title: Senior Data Analyst (IAM) (GCS)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Data Analyst (IAM) (GCS)

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As part of RBC’s digital transformation the Identity & Access Management (IAM) team is building out a data analytics & identity governance pillar with the mandate to consolidate, cleanse, govern, and enrich our IAM data to make strong data driven strategic decisions.  The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible to build and maintain the analytics model using RBC’s analytics tools, support the ongoing evolution of the IAM Data Analytics function, including finding new and innovative insights from existing or potential data sources, and identification of new opportunities to strengthen governance processes and reduce risk.

What will you do?

  • Develop and lead the requirements gathering, documentation, data capture, and analysis processes in partnership with stakeholders
  • Leverage visualization dashboard to present data-driven insights and actionable recommendations, ensuring that the information is easily understood and interpreted.
  • Conduct exploratory analysis and interpretation of new and different data sources to identify valuable and innovative insights.
  • Work with teams across IAM and the enterprise, to find new opportunities to strengthen reporting and challenge existing analytics & governance models
  • Provide guidance, feedback, coaching, and mentoring to build the capabilities of other Data Analyst(s) on the team

What do you need to succeed?

  • 4+ years of experience performing common extract, transform, load (ETL) operations on structured datasets
  • 1-2 years of experience with data visualization/business insights tools, such as Tableau
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL
  • Experience with requirements gathering and documentation
  • Experience with programming and scripting languages (eg. Python, SQL)
  • Understanding of data management practices and data pipelines
  • Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal)
  • Strong critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills

Nice-to-have

  • Familiarity with the IAM domain and data
  • Experience in team Leadership and mentoring
  • Strong Excel and powerpoint skills
  • Experience working with big data tools/solutions

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Data Analyst / Data Solution Architect

Job Description

Data Analytics and Consolidation Services

  • Support RBC enterprise wide client and credit information consolidation and analytics based on Enterprise Business Registry (EBR) functions.
  • Provide day to day reference data services (initiatives and inquiries) for EBR consumers i.e. Enterprise Risk Reporting, Capital Measurement, Large Exposure Framework (LEF) reporting and IFRS9.
  • Build the data controls for critical reference data elements that EBR owns the derivation and precedence rules.
  • Build the data controls and attestations for reference data that EBR published and exception reports.
  • Regularly monitor the exception reports and attestation results to assess the impact to EBR data consumers.
  • Support the review and challenge of the data assessment from RBC finance and risk data second line of defense units for EBR perspective.
  • Support the data quality investigation and remediation action from Finance and Risk Data Management Office.
  • Maintain the proof of records for Initiatives, Investigation, Challenges, and Data Audits from various RBC data policy and control units from EBR perspective.

Reference Data and Rules Management

  • Maintain and document the enterprise critical Credit Risk Data Element derivation and precedence rules with Risk and Finance stakeholders (i.e. business owners from Credit Risk, Finance and Capital Measurement, Risk Models and Parameter Estimation, Risk and Finance Reporting adjudicators etc.)
  • Engage the enterprise stakeholders and manage the rule reviews.
  • Manage the reference data rule inquiries and investigations with stakeholders and data consumers.
  • Oversight the quality of critical Credit Risk Data Elements and data issue reporting impacts for areas including Enterprise Risk Reporting (ERR), Wholesale Portfolio Management (WCPM), Wholesale Credit Risk (WCR), Special Loan (SL), Wholesale Parameter Estimation, Finance and Risk Capital.
  • Execute the data controls and attestations to assess the effectiveness of Credit Risk Reference Data and relevant reporting process impact.
  • Report impact and assist in possible solutions for data defects and remediation.
  • Advise on reference data risk control adjudications.
  • Manage the coordination and reviews for remediation activities with Finance and Risk Data Management and Operations
  • Support regulatory reviews, audit inquiries, self-assessments and exams as appropriate.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-Have:

  • Credit Risk and/or Finance Management: Minimum 2-3 years’ experience in any area among Credit Risk management, modelling or reporting in the areas of Wholesale/Retail Credit Risk, Wholesale Portfolio Management and Risk Reporting, Capital and Finance calculation and reporting, etc.
  • Data Analytics and Business Data Requirement: Proven experience as a senior data analyst. Ability to independently query databases, consolidates data, automate the data collection, conduct analysis, review logic and business rules. Supply explicit business data requirement for IT counterparts.
  • Data Quality Management:  Ability to design and execute appropriate scenarios, tests and analytical approaches to validate the quality of data and reports, test the effectiveness of data controls.
  • Communication: Effective written and oral communications skills to explain concepts, structure content and proven ability to communicate to different levels.
  • Problem Solving: Creative thinking to support or advise the development of creative solutions.
  • Agile, Structured Thinking & Critical Reasoning:  Ability to adapt quickly and learn and innovate while dealing with ambiguity and unknowns by creating structure to reach solutions.
  • Collaboration: Ability to engage and collaborate with medium to large groups of counterparts and audience.
  • Networking: Ability to build and utilize internal networks

Nice to Have:

  • Assurance and/or management consulting experience are a plus.
  • Analytical and modelling experience is a plus.
  • Tableau development experience is a great asset.
  • Credit Risk report preparation experience is a plus.
  • Understanding of major risk/finance regulatory requirements and/or BCBS 239 Principles.
  • Knowledge of RBC’s finance/risk systems infrastructure and data architecture is a plus.
  • Graduate degree in business or related discipline and/or MBA, or other professional related qualification.
  • Minimum 2-3 years’ experience in data quality related activities. 

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work

Job Summary

Manage the Enterprise Reference Data analytics and Data solutions from financial institution’s Risk and Finance perspective. Assist in establishment and execution of Reference Data Management Framework and Data Controls to safeguard the reference data published to RBC Risk and Finance reporting units. Provide day to day service to enterprise consumers and stakeholders of reference data consumed and published. Manage the reference data precedence rule and reviews with stakeholders. Manage the reference data consumption and sourcing improvement and development based on regulatory and consumer/provider initiatives.

item.title: Senior Data and Reporting Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Data and Reporting Analyst

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Identifying, sizing and prioritizing business opportunities for improvement through analytics.
  • Assessing the scope and resources required of various analytics projects and working with manager to define necessary resources.
  • Managing client relations to ensure that expectations for dashboards are managed, and fulfilled.
  • Develops, maintains and supports Tableau dashboards including any automated processes in place to populate the dashboards.
  • Work with various support teams to ensure requirements are met by infrastructure using reporting tools (Tableau, ServiceNow, Excel)
  • Monitoring and communicating key performance metrics and operational challenges.

EXECUTION AND OPERATIONAL EXCELLENCE

  • Develops, maintains and supports Tableau dashboards including any automated processes in place to populate the dashboards.
  • Provide day-to-day support and escalation as required for faults and problems.
  • Work with various support teams to ensure requirements are met by infrastructure using reporting tools (Tableau, ServiceNow, Excel)
  • Explores alternative options and recommends technology solutions and designs that meet sponsor needs and project life cycle deliverables
  • Works closely with third party vendors as required.
  • Takes part in small to large group meetings for technical design, report design, decision making, problem solving and task implementation.
  • Conduct maintenance of all aspects of the supported Tableau infrastructure used by Resiliency team.
  • Ensures that all issues are addressed in a timely manner and as set out in operational level agreements and conduct reviews at the end of each quarter​

PROJECTS AND INITIATIVES

  • Assesses, researches and analyzes business and system needs, exploring alternative options to recommend technology solutions and designs that meet sponsor needs and PLC deliverables including component reusability, data sharing and security.
  • Develops proposals for senior management.
  • Contributes to successful project completion by identifying risks and developing and/or recommending mitigation strategies.
  • Assist in projects/investigations as assigned.
  • Gather requirements for projects from stakeholders.
  • Promote and enforce best practices for Tableau, Reporting and Resiliency initiatives
  • Works with enterprise Resiliency teams in the delivery, testing and implementation of services as required.
  • Ensures that a high quality of service is provided to clients.
  • Assist where applicable in the design of new Tableau and reporting dashboards, reports and services.
  • Champion Tableau and resiliency team needs and work with various units and teams to deliver on time and within budget.

Planning, Implementation & Support

  • Performs performance tuning to improve performance of tool environments
  • Performs capacity planning and environment management for reporting tool environments.
  • Provides 7.5hrsx5 days a week third level support to the reporting tool environments

Relationships & Communication

  • Effectively communicates and builds rapport with team members, stakeholders and interface groups using a variety of techniques and collaboration from initiation to close.
  • Facilitates small group meetings for technical design, report design, decision making, problem solving and task implementation.
  • Resolves conflicts/issues and escalates others as appropriate.

Development & Coaching

  • Continually enhances skills and builds knowledge in all aspects of the organization, the business and information systems.

Required Skills

  • Experience using BI Reporting Tools (ex. Tableau, Power BI);  creating and enhancing reports
  • Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Office Suite Proficiency
  • Good understanding of SQL (Structured Query Language)
  • Business Analytics, Agile development life cycle and Kanban
  • Good communication skills and comfortable in presenting and/or facilitating to small groups of individuals of varied career levels.
  • Comfortable working a product owner independently to gather and refine requirements.

Nice to Have

  • PYTHON or scripting language for data transformation and data injection.
  • Comfortable using databases (creating tables, views, indexes) and a good understanding of database concepts.
  • Experience using a database (PostgreSQL, SQL Server)
  • Critical Thinking;
  • Data Administration; Data Modeling; Data Movement;
  • Detail-Oriented and problem solving methodology

Comfortable working Independently or in small teams.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law. ​

Job Summary

Manages the development, implementation and support of business analytics initiatives and projects. Applies experience and seasoned knowledge, skills, and practices to perform a variety of assignments. Provides third level support of reporting tool environments, as well as consulting and technical expertise on implementation of tools to support business and technical requirements.

item.title: Control Assurance Manager
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Control Assurance Manager

Job Description

  • Responsible for the effective and efficient management of the team, ensuring that all services are rendered in an accurate and timely manner
  • Accountable for the cross location collaboration (other GSP Centers) to ensure contingency support as well as consistency in procedures and delivery
  • Accountable for the quality of the services delivered & for the management of a team or an activity - first level of escalation
  • Accountable for procedures\' validation and implementation
  • Promote quality of deliverables by working with production manager on motivating, coaching and developing team members
  • Identify and share development and training needs , design training plan for the year
  • Responsible for identifying areas where efficiencies and accuracy improvements can be made and implement a plan of action

What you need to succeed in the role:

  • Sound technical and financial knowledge on reference data.
  • Knowledge of different investment instrument types
  • Experience in operation environment
  • Self-starter, self- discipline and works independently to set own sub-goals to achieve all deadlines.
  • Good interpersonal skills and networking abilities with all stakeholders.
  • High sense of responsibility and taking ownership for all prices delivered to stakeholder
  • Organization awareness (Risk Mitigation Focus)
  • Strong people management experience

Job Summary

RBC Investor & Treasury Services Malaysia is a processing center of operational excellence supporting 10 countries across three geographical time zones. Malaysia is one of two operational processing hubs that supports Custody - Transaction Management; Settlements; NAV Production; Fund Reporting; Shareholder Services; Global Fund Platform Services; Data Service Delivery; Entitlements – income and corporate actions and Reconciliations. The country employs a Global Operating Model to maximise efficiencies across times zones and supports a 24/5 operational capability. The objectives for Malaysia are to enhance the scalability of our global operations, improve service quality via our ‘centres of excellence’ and to implement/leverage standard processes globally
